quote: #1 Once you have their money, you never give it back
author: Ferengi rules of acquisition

quote: #3 Never spend more for an acquisition than you have to
author: Ferengi rules of acquisition

quote: #6 Never allow family to stand in the way of opportunity
author: Ferengi rules of acquisition

quote: #7 Keep you ears open
author: Ferengi rules of acquisition

quote: #9 Opportunity + instinct equals profit
author: Ferengi rules of acquisition

quote: #10 Greed is eternal
author: Ferengi rules of acquisition

quote: #16 A deal is a deal
author: Ferengi rules of acquisition

quote: #17 A contract is a contract is a contract... but only between Ferengi
author: Ferengi rules of acquisition

quote: #18 A Ferengi without profit is no Ferengi at all
author: Ferengi rules of acquisition

quote: #21 Never place friendship above profit
author: Ferengi rules of acquisition

quote: #22 A wise man can hear profit in the wind
author: Ferengi rules of acquisition

quote: #23 Nothing is more important than your health... except for your money
author: Ferengi rules of acquisition

quote: #31 Never make fun of a Ferengi's mother
author: Ferengi rules of acquisition

quote: #33 It never hurts to suck up to the boss
author: Ferengi rules of acquisition

quote: #34 War is good for business
author: Ferengi rules of acquisition

quote: #35 Peace is good for business
author: Ferengi rules of acquisition

quote: #45 Expand or die.
author: Ferengi rules of acquisition

quote: #47 Don't trust a man wearing a better suit than our own
author: Ferengi rules of acquisition

quote: #48 The bigger the smile, the sharper the knife
author: Ferengi rules of acquisition

quote: #59 Good customers are as rare as latinum; treasure them
author: Ferengi rules of acquisition

quote: #59 Free advice is seldom cheap
author: Ferengi rules of acquisition

quote: #62 The riskier the road, the greater the profit
author: Ferengi rules of acquisition

quote: #74 Knowledge equals profit
author: Ferengi rules of acquisition

quote: #75 Home is where the heart is, but the stars are made of latinum
author: Ferengi rules of acquisition

quote: #76 Every once in a while, declare peace. It confuses the hell out of your enemies
author: Ferengi rules of acquisition

quote: #94 Females and finances don't mix
author: Ferengi rules of acquisition

quote: #95 Expand or die
author: Ferengi rules of acquisition

quote: #98 Every man has his price
author: Ferengi rules of acquisition

quote: #102 Nature decays, but latinum lasts forever
author: Ferengi rules of acquisition

quote: #103 Sleep can interfere with...
author: Ferengi rules of acquisition

quote: #109 Dignity and an empty sack is worth the sack
author: Ferengi rules of acquisition

quote: #111 Treat people in your debt like family... exploit them
author: Ferengi rules of acquisition

quote: #112 Never have sex with the boss's sister
author: Ferengi rules of acquisition

quote: #125 You can't make a deal if you're dead
author: Ferengi rules of acquisition

quote: #139 Wives serve, brothers inherit
author: Ferengi rules of acquisition

quote: #168 Whisper your way to success
author: Ferengi rules of acquisition

quote: #190 Hear all... trust nothing
author: Ferengi rules of acquisition

quote: #194 It's always good to know about new customers before they walk in your door
author: Ferengi rules of acquisition

quote: #203 New customers are like razor-toothed gree-worms. They can be succulent, but sometimes they bite back
author: Ferengi rules of acquisition

quote: #208 Sometimes then only thing more dangerous than a question is an answer
author: Ferengi rules of acquisition

quote: #211 Employees are the rungs on the ladder of success. Don't hesitate to step on them
author: Ferengi rules of acquisition

quote: #214 Never begin a business negotiation on an empty stomach
author: Ferengi rules of acquisition

quote: #217 You can't free a fish from water
author: Ferengi rules of acquisition

quote: #229 Latinum lasts longer than lust
author: Ferengi rules of acquisition

quote: #239 Never be afraid to mislabel a product
author: Ferengi rules of acquisition

quote: #263 Never allow doubt to tarnish you lust for latinum
author: Ferengi rules of acquisition

quote: #285 No good deed ever goes unpunished
author: Ferengi rules of acquisition

quote: It has been my experience that folks who have no vices have very few virtues
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Most people are about as happy as they make up their minds to be
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Whatever you are, be a good one
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: He can compress the most words into the smallest ideas better than any man I ever met
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Whenever I hear anyone arguing for slavery, I feel a strong impulse to see it tried on him personally
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: If this is coffee, please bring me some tea; if this is tea, please bring me some coffee
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: No matter how much cats fight, there always seem to be plenty of kittens
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Things may come to those who wait, but only the things left by those who hustle
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: America will never be destroyed from the outside. If we falter and lose our freedoms, it will be because we destroyed ourselves
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Tact: the ability to describe others as they see themselves.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Life isn't about finding yourself. Life is about creating yourself
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: The reasonable man adapts himself to the world: the unreasonable one persists in trying to adapt the world to himself. Therefore all progress depends on the unreasonable man.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: He who can, does. He who cannot, teaches.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Life does not cease to be funny when people die any more than it ceases to be serious when people laugh.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Some people feel the rain, others just get wet
author: Bob Dylan

quote: He who is not busy being born is busy dying.
author: Bob Dylan

quote: Work expands to fill time available
author: Cyril Parkinson

quote: Hofstadter's Law: It always takes longer than you expect, even when you take into account Hofstadter's Law.
author: Douglas Hofstadter
source: Gödel, Escher, and Bach: An Eternal Golden Braid

quote: Technology is anything that wasn't around when you were born.
author: Alan Kay

quote: No place is more than two meals from a revolution
author: Larry Niven

quote: You can tell the history of jazz in four words: Louis Armstrong, Charlie Parker
author: Miles Davis

quote: If Tyranny and Oppression come to this land, it will be in the guise of fighting a foreign enemy.
author: James Madison

quote: All men having power ought to be mistrusted.
author: James Madison

quote: As a man is said to have a right to his property, he may be equally said to have a property in his rights.
author: James Madison

quote: War cannot be avoided; it can only be postponed to the other's advantage.
author: Niccolo Machiavelli

quote: There is no other way of guarding oneself against flattery than by letting men understand that they will not offend you by speaking the truth; but when everyone can tell you the truth, you lose their respect.
author: Niccolo Machiavelli

quote: The two symbols of the Republican Party: an elephant, and a big fat white guy who is threatened by change.
author: Seth MacFarlane

quote: I have been thinking that I would make a proposition to my Republican friends... that if they will stop telling lies about the Democrats, we will stop telling the truth about them.
author: Adlai Stevenson

quote: You get fifteen democrats in a room, and you get twenty opinions.
author: Patrick Leahy

quote: The only difference between the Democrats and the Republicans is that the Democrats allow the poor to be corrupt, too.
author: Oscar Levant

quote: I belong to no organized party. I am a Democrat.
author: Will Rogers

quote: A bureaucrat is a Democrat who holds some office that a Republican wants.
author: Alan Barkley

quote: One man's constant is another man's variable.
author: Alan J. Perlis

quote: Every program is a part of some other program and rarely fits.
author: Alan J. Perlis

quote: It is easier to write an incorrect program than understand a correct one.
author: Alan J. Perlis

quote: It is better to have 100 functions operate on one data structure than 10 functions on 10 data structures.
author: Alan J. Perlis

quote: Get into a rut early: Do the same process the same way. Accumulate idioms. Standardize. The only difference(!) between Shakespeare and you was the size of his idiom list - not the size of his vocabulary.
author: Alan J. Perlis

quote: Everything should be built top-down, except the first time.
author: Alan J. Perlis

quote: Every program has (at least) two purposes: the one for which it was written, and another for which it wasn't.
author: Alan J. Perlis

quote: A language that doesn't affect the way you think about programming, is not worth knowing.
author: Alan J. Perlis

quote: Optimization hinders evolution.
author: Alan J. Perlis

quote: For systems, the analogue of a face-lift is to add to the control graph an edge that creates a cycle, not just an additional node.
author: Alan J. Perlis

quote: In programming, everything we do is a special case of something more general -- and often we know it too quickly.
author: Alan J. Perlis

quote: Simplicity does not precede complexity, but follows it.
author: Alan J. Perlis

quote: Everyone can be taught to sculpt: Michelangelo would have had to be taught not to. So it is with great programmers.
author: Alan J. Perlis

quote: The use of a program to prove the 4-color theorem will not change mathematics - it merely demonstrates that the theorem, a challenge for a century, is probably not important to mathematics.
author: Alan J. Perlis

quote: Re graphics: A picture is worth 10K words - but only those to describe the picture. Hardly any sets of 10K words can be adequately described with pictures.
author: Alan J. Perlis

quote: Some programming languages manage to absorb change, but withstand progress.
author: Alan J. Perlis

quote: The best book on programming for the layman is Alice in Wonderland; but that's because it's the best book on anything for the layman.
author: Alan J. Perlis

quote: Beware of the Turing tar-pit in which everything is possible but nothing of interest is easy.
author: Alan J. Perlis

quote: It is easier to change the specification to fit the program than vice versa.
author: Alan J. Perlis

quote: Fools ignore complexity. Pragmatists suffer it. Some can avoid it. Geniuses remove it.
author: Alan J. Perlis

quote: In programming, as in everything else, to be in error is to be reborn.
author: Alan J. Perlis

quote: Is it possible that software is not like anything else, that it is meant to be discarded: that the whole point is to see it as a soap bubble?
author: Alan J. Perlis

quote: It is the user who should parameterize procedures, not their creators.
author: Alan J. Perlis

quote: Prolonged contact with the computer turns mathematicians into clerks and vice versa.
author: Alan J. Perlis

quote: One does not learn computing by using a hand calculator, but one can forget arithmetic.
author: Alan J. Perlis

quote: Interfaces keep things tidy, but don't accelerate growth: Functions do.
author: Alan J. Perlis

quote: The proof of a system's value is its existence.
author: Alan J. Perlis

quote: Computer Science is embarrassed by the computer.
author: Alan J. Perlis

quote: The only constructive theory connecting neuroscience and psychology will arise from the study of software.
author: Alan J. Perlis

quote: Problems cannot be solved by the same level of thinking that created them.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Each snowflake in an avalanche pleads not guilty
author: Stanislav Lec

quote: When the rich make war, it's the poor that die.
author: Jean-Paul Satre

quote: I thought I am not good enough for physics and I am too good for philosophy. Mathematics is in between.
author: George Polya

quote: Television is something the Russians invented to destroy American education.
author: Paul Erdös

quote: As the pattern gets more intricate and subtle, being swept along is no longer enough.
author: Richard Linklater

quote: Whoso belongs only to his own age, and reverences only its gilt Popinjays or smoot-smeared Mumbojumbos, must needs die with it.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: I never desire to converse with a man who has written more than he has read.
author: Samuel Johnson
